body.p:
Extracts from Various letters recd by A. Hart at Philadelphia from
Mr Warden Cresson (Mickal Board Israel) now at from Jerusalem. Jerusalem Tamuz 2d 5613

I am now in the Holy City where
I arrived last Monday afternoon in good health

I have got a House and a fine large
Room suitable to commence my “Soup House”
as soon as I am furnished with sufficient means
to go on with, I have gone as far as I can with
my scanty supply

My machinery I expect on here some
time this month from England, and that from
America is in Smyrna

Mrs. Minor & John Mashulum have quarre-
led & parted, as I said, I thought would be the
case & it has resulted in two parts of Palestine
being brought under an improved System of
American & English. Agriculture, Artoss & the
most beautiful Gardens of Jaffa, the first being
supplied with water, naturally & continually
running over the ground & the latter artifi-
cially by pumps, or wheels raising it up in
buckets, only a few feet from the surface of
the earth. The Orange, the Lemon, the Pomgran-
ite, the Fig_The Banana_the Mulberry, the Olive
the Sugar Cane & the Sessamine?, luxuriate there,
& the Sweet Potatoe has produced such an
increase both in size & weight, that it seems
almost incredable since they have been intro-
duced there, No Winter, continual Water & Sun & if the Wind-Mills & common Hydraulic pumps, should
be introduced, instead of the present mule & Jackass
wheels, it seems that there would be no limit to
the increase, as the Gardens there produce 2 crops

of Oranges & Lemons a year & several vegita-
bles.

Jerusalem has improved greatly since
I left, altho this year they had no rain until
within 2 weeks of Purim—many good buildings
have been erected, & a great many Olive trees
& Thousands & hundreds of Thousands of Mullberry
trees have been planted within a short dis-
tance of the Jaffa Gate which all look well,
& give it a very lively appearance.

When Sir Moses Montifore was here he
gave the poor Jews more than $25000 in 5 or 6 days
(a little more or less) it was all eat up & gone forever.
If he had made a permanent Fund of that sum,
he could have got here 15 per cent with the very best
security upon Real Estate, Houses, Land &c, &c, &c
$25000 at 15 per cent per Annum would have produced
$3.700 & this would have built 45 one story houses,
12 feet square, that would have rented for more than
15 per A. per Annum, & would have been entirely
Fire Proof having Stone Arched Roofs, or he might
have appropriated the Interest of that sum to the
support of a “Soup House” connected with a
system for promoting Industry amongst his
poor brethren here, & it would have made
in Moses and “Everlasting Name” here in the “Holy
City” in this “Crown of Glory” when “She shall be
called, the Lord our Righteousness” “see Jeveh. 33. c. 16v.”
yea an everlasting name that shall not be cut
off” I am very sorry I did not receive the letter
that you say in your last “May 27th” that you had
“recently written to me” it must have arrived

in London just after I left, or 10 or 12 days after
as I left upon the 26th of May—I waited there week
after week, & month after month for a good sailing
vessel coming direct to Jaffa encouraged so to
do both by friends & the Brokers, as there had always
been sailing vessels coming there, but all the
vessels were immediately chartered for some
part of Australia, For Philip, Melbourne, Sidney
or Victoria, at ? the usual price of Freight
no Vessels coming to Jaffa & the Brokers saying
that “they never saw any thing like it” & finding
my necessary expenses would eat up all
my money. I thought of bringing my machi-
nery & goods over France or by Steam Boat,
but upon inquiry I found that would never
do, the few things I did bring over France, cost
me as much, or more than they were all worth
& nearly, or quite as much as my passage, I
therefore stored all my things safely up, & left
them subject to an order given by me to my
Broker James Ilberry No. 11 Beer Lane in London, to be
sent by the first sailing vessel coming to Jaffa,
to the Care of the American Counsel Jacob S. Meerad,
for me, The English Counsel Mr Kyatt of Jaffa
whom I called to see, also had a large quantity
of Goods that was were waiting to come as well as mine
left to the care of Mr Olliver & Clementson No 23 East
India Chambers London Hall St. (Brokers) who also
promised to let my Broker know, if they chartered
a vessel first, So I stored my machinery & Goods
safe & left upon the 26th of May in the French Steamer
for Dieppe & came through France to Marseilles,
thence to Malta, Syra, Smyrna, Marsina, Alexandria
Latakia, Tripoli, Beyrout, Jaffa & then to this place

=Jerusalem were I arrived upon the 3rd day
of July 1853, at noon none of the places could I do any
kind of business to any advantage Altho, I
found nut Galls, Wool, Madder & other things very
low indeed at Alexandriatta, Latakia, Tripoli &c
the trade was monopolized by the French
Steam Packets Company, so that no one individ
ual would be safe with only a small capital
to attempt to commence business, at any of
the above posts or places in opposition to them
just so with Opium when I was at Smyrna
it was sent in large quantities to India at
small profits. Now we will refer go to the “Soup
House” and I will inform you all about that,
since I arrived Here I have presented my
“Circular” to the Haham Pacha Rabbi Hiam
Nissan Abbolofia & all the House of Judgement
(“Beth Din”) of the Sefhardim Congregation & they
say “they greatly approve of my plan for feeding the
poor & will Back my “Circular Letter” with another or
others of theirs” they appointed a Committee
of 7 men several to act with me & have offered to let
me have a piece of Land belonging to the
Congregation Collet & another Garden joining with 7 wells
in it, the spot where King David had his
Palace but it will require $3 or 400 to get
either of them in a fit condition for a “Soup
House” therefore it would be better to rent a
house already fit for use for only $70 or 75
per annum, but it will require $300 or $400 to get either of them
in a fit condition for planting,
On last Friday the 26th of Augt
“The Harts Society” made its first actual dis-
tribution of Read of Bread Meal & Rice for the
poor in the Holy City to near 80 families. here now is something
here practical something tangible (thank God for it), to prevent Apostacy” as it is starvation

that produces it in 8 out of 10 cases at to near 80
Families, Practical something tangible, thank God for it. Now they can no longer say “Of
all that has been done there has never been any
thing practical in Jerusalem yet & one thing most
important is settled with the present committee
here. That there shall be printed copies of the
way manner the money has been expended sent to
the donors annually”. “The Rich are not to partake
of it for they really need it not, nor any drunk-
ard or profligate, all kinds of profitable industry
is to be connected with the Institution.
yours Truly
Michael B?

P.S. Will not the Rich ? help us
when they read Hacam Hacham Pachas letter? surely
when they ascertain it is only to keep life
together until they can be taught some kind
of means to support themselves by making
Ink Black distilling oil of Lemon, bottling Wine &
Oil, packing Skins, tilling the soil &c, yours &c
Jerusalem 1853

I can assure you I
have had it hard enough I am only an Individ
ual, & had only about ?, I had all my
machinery to buy—heavy post office duties—all the
“Circular letters” (2000) to pay for, all advertisements,
Lecture Rooms, Cards, distributing them & notices
which is but a part of my expenses nearly all had
nearly to come out of my small sum or pittance
(for I had to live & travel all the way here) & make
a respectable appearance, even the money that
was raised or given at my many Lectures in London
I requested to be placed in the hands of some
well known trusty person as Treasurer in London, until
something practical or tangible was done
in Jerusalem, that I would not take one
cent of it until something was first done

=in the Holy City, & Mr. A. Greene the Revd. Israelite
above mentioned was nominated in London, & the same
thing at Hirsh Lehrens Esq. of Amsterdam, even
the writing of all the 6 or 7 letters in Hebrew as
well as the 1st distribution I must pay for, the
Letters at 1st 10 Piasters each & the latter will be printed
hereafter when further distributions are made
I have done all I could and more perhaps than
I ought to have done & it leaves me in a far coun=
=try a “Stranger” almost with only a little trifle more than
One Soverign, but my trust is all in the one only
True God, I can live on only two meals a day.
When you send the $50 you subscribed, that must
go to the Rent of a “Soup House” & I have received
word from Dr. Schlegsinger of Frankfort on
the Maine that Baron Willy Rotchchild, “approves
of the plan & will subscribe largely if approved
of by the great men of London” however it
is now gone forth & is wafted on the 4 wings of
heaven we must wait patiently & see, for
unless or “Except the Lord build the house, they
labour in Vain that build it. Psa. 127. IV. You
were the first unostentatious supporter of
it, therefore it is to be called “The Hart Benevolent
Society, for promoting industry among
Israelites in the Holy Land,” God knows it is
greatly needed here for the missionaries
are using the very same kind of Policy, that
the Emperor of Russia, is now using towards the
Turks & has already cost the Sultan more
than 100 millions & that is not open warfare”
but running him to vast expense & has
already in some cases produced almost
Starvation for the Turkish soldiers leave

p.rend: The following is written in the left margin, beginning near line 23.

body.p:
dont put
this in italics
as the copyist has
marked it

the fields in many instances & “say they can-
-not fight unless they get something to eat” so
with the missionaries here, it is not a question
wether their work is a work of Conviction
& conversion on the part of the Jews for it is not,
but the pressure & forcing of the Stomach, already
have 5 cases within a stones throw of me joined
the English mission from this only cause about
the time I reached here & one of them now
says if he can only have two piasters a day
he will leave Jerusalem & come back to his
religion” & another came to me & said if I would
only give him a small house to live in he would
come back & be a Jew. My heart and soul is sick altho'
my health is good, and when you are setting by
your Lamp or candle of an evening think that the Flame
of that Lamp or Candle burns so long only as it is
supplied with oil or tallow..so has it been with
the flame of Life with many a precious soul here
but still they have held together fast their
justification with their God, many to the death.

I wish Mr Lyon to send me his price Current
regularly from New York every month, when you
next address me please write on thin paper, the
last one of yours cost me 42 Piasters. Thank
you for your good wishes may God Bless you for your
good heart, and as I now have access to the
area of the Holy Temple and as God declared in 2 Chron
=icles, 6._32d & 33d Verses that “when the Stranger which comes
from afar country thou hear from Heaven thy dwel-
-ling place and do all the stranger calleth to the for”
If I am spared on the 1st of 7th month (new moon) I intend
to put up a prayer that the life of your dear little Son
be spared you & that you may live to see his Nuptials
Yours Truly

Altho' I have not received any
answer as yet from you to my last, yet as there
are several things of much importance that I
wish to write to you about, I shall again address
you.

1st Then I wish very much to know
whether America remains neutral, in this
great War which is now declared, in which
so many nations have taken sides & if you
would send me now & then one or two of your
newspapers with the most general & correct
statement of affairs when you are done
with them I would thank you very much
indeed, & whenever you send me any money
or any thing else, you had better send it
through our American Consul to Jacob
S Meerād American Counsul at Jaffa for me
Four 4 Mashumats have already left them &
returned & have confessed their Error & more
are coming, I have been informed, & it is all
laid to my being here, & the missionaries
& myself have had several hard bats & they
have reported that I have been hired
as a missionary by the Jews to come on
here on purpose to get back the Jews converts “but
I have told them” that I have never received
as much as one cent for that purpose,
but example here, is an hundredfold more
powerful in this day, than all the prea-
ching especially when it is confirmed
by every sacrifice & especially in Jerusalem
where religion is all & every thing

Within a little more than a
month & since the war has been declared

most things have risen here very much indeed
here so that if they continue to rise in price
as much more in the same length of time,
there will be a great deal of suffering here
indeed, I have been sick 3 times of the Fever
since I came here & have not had a single
person to wait upon me as I could not
afford to pay more than $1 a day them.

I have just time to inform you that
the Soup House is commenced, since I last
wrote you I have rented a house with 3
Rooms & plenty of Water for one year for the
moderate sum of 350 Piasters= to ($14) It is
called “Hart's Benevolent Soup Society” & a neat
sign of my own workmanship painted
blue with block letters is just finished. I
have worked day & night & made all the
stands for the boards to lay on to form the
Tables, the Benches are made, I have got
Furnaces ready made, for only 7 ½ Piasters
30 cts 2 Copper boilers & 1 large copper Basin
for the Soup for the latter 80 Piasters or $3.20 & the
former 72 P. (or $2.88) for 150 Piasters, less than I could have
brought Iron Boiler from England to France
for I have a good man & his wife for only
5 to 7 Piasters for both a day, I shall only begin
once or twice a week as I can manage hold it un-
till I can get some further assistance,
As it is ascertained, that the same amoun-
-nt of money, laid out in Soup will go
three 3 times as far as in any other manner
as yet known and as the money I rec

hope will be most honestly laid out for the
deserving & suffering poor, most faithfully
& conscientiously, as we have know a most
excellent & unexceptional committee
of 7 men, who are willing to render to the
donors an account of all money expended,
I have now in hand, including what was
laid out in the first distribution as follows

list.item: From Mr Henry Herman Dayton, Ohio $10.00
do Mr Simion Brumdis Levy New York $1.00

body.p:
my expenses thus far for Rent paid before hand
for House for a year Copper Kettles, Boards, & scant
ling &c including 1st distribution, has not in all
amounted to quite $31 900 Piasters, now the next wise
movement will be to try & make the insti
tution support itself by opening in the room
adjoining the “Soup House” a little store for
selling Tea, Sugar, Coffee, Sheetings & drillings
If we cannot find charitable persons with
Heart enough, to lend an helping hand to
make a given sum go the furtherest possible
way & to prevent the wrong use of money as
has been the case.

p.del:
Things remain quiet still here
but not so in Some neighbouring places
where te Turks have arisen against the
Greeks, American, i, c, Amalekites who

have ceded against them with Russia,
I need very much a double barreled Gun
or even two one barreled for Shot, & the
other for Rifle barrel, for a Ball if things come
to the worst here, they can be bought for about
15 to 18 dollars at Mr Dilworth's, in Market just
below Second St. north side where I dealth
for 2 years and more they warrant them.

body.p:
Since I last wrote, things here are still
becoming more interesting, the Greeks & Latins
commenced killing each other. off only a
few days since, at Jaffa, 5 were killed besid
es some wounded, but the New Pacha
arrived in this city last Thursday, the 16th
& has forbid all exportation of Wheat, from
here to Europe in his Firman, which was
read yesterday, & the first man that strikes the
first blow here, whether Turk, Jew, or Christian
is to be imprisoned”—We have received a
letter here from one of our collectors for
the Poor at Babylon, saying, that on his way
from Bagdad he must met immense bodies of sol-
diers coming from Persia & India to assist Russia
(from Circassia & from Khebār) the Turks have
lately got a most severe beating from Russians
& the Theological Seminary consisting of
2500 young men (students) all turned out.

Constantinople was thrown into a
fearful state of alarm & consternation, the
Christians all fled over the Bridge until
quiet was partially restored. One of the
Offenders (Priests) left Constantinople &

went to Egypt & called upon Mahomet Ali, and
informed him that only the night before at
½ past 12 Oclock the Prophet Mahomet appear-
ed to him & told him that he must go to Ma-
homet Ali & tell him to kill of all the Christians
(Infidels) he asked the man his name, he
told him that it was “Saliman” Well says
Mahomet Ali, “Saliman” at one O'Clock last
night, the Prophet mahommed appeared to
me & told me that a man by the name of
“Saliman” would come to me at this time &
that I must give him a good Bastinading
& he ordered his canvass to do it, so the story goes,
It looks quite probable that India will
join such a powerful Kingdom as Russia
against, England, who has been so long at
War with her and be glad of the opportunity
Last Thursday Mr James Finn the English
Consul informed me that an English officer
on a Visit, received orders to leave here imme-
diately, and join his Regiment at Const-
antinople “Proclaim ye this among the Gen-
tiles; Prepare War wake up the mighty men,
let all the mighty men of War draw near; let
them come up” Job, 3-9-It appears now as all the
different nations mentioned by the Prophet
Jeremiah in his 5/c 27 & 28v had actually joined
the “King of the North” & when the Roman Empire
was rotton & corrupt before, with all her boasted
strength, the Northern of Europe & Western of
Asia the Scandinavians sarmatians, Huns,
& hundreds of other tribes, around the Baltic
north of the Himali & east of the Ural, it
fell beneath these northern barbarians

whose very descendants are now getting ready
to distroy continental Europe. We can get great
light from Isaiahs 13 Chapr. Which appears to
correspond with Jeremiahs 50 & 51 Chapters. Isaiah
says—He saw it concerning Babylon & in
his 14 & 26 verses he tells us what Babylon it
is & in the 4th verse of the 13th Chapter he says
“a noise of the multitude in the mountains,
as if of a great people a tumultuous noise of
Kingdoms of nations gathered together:
The Lord of Hosts mustereth the Host of the
Battle” & to thoroughly convince ourselves
that it cannot be confined to the Literal
Babylon, which is destroyed please atten-
tively read the above mentioned 14th 26 v of
Isaih. & the 50 c 4 to 9 verses of Jeremiah; Upon
the 16th day of the present month I received
a letter from our Consul J. Hosford Smith
at Beyrout, that all my goods & machinery
had arrived there in the ship Alexandria
from London & that he would do his best to
get them through the Custom House by
paying as little Duty as possible & that the
expense for freight to that port was £10.10. 3d
besides postage & Lighterage I immediately
inclosed the amt. and ordered him to
send them here by the First French Steamer
to Jaffa. Wheat has been as high here as
25 Piasters for 1 Timnah or 27 of our pounds & none
in our Bazaar or market at that, the suffering
here has truly been great among our brethren
& upon Purim (last week) such a sight I
never before saw for eagerness to obtain releif,
my door was full & I could not close it &
which a Heart of Stone could not withstand

I know that I am considerably lighter than
I was before Purim, do not mean in pounds of flesh
but in pocket. than I was a few days since, I
intend to write & inclose a letter to my friend
Townsen a Sharpless the Rich merchant &
Quaker or Friend at the “Sign of the Bee Hive” in
Second St. & request him to lay the present state
of Israel here before the coming monthly & Yearly
Society of Friends, hoping that they will prove
themselves friends to Israel (as they have done to
the American Indians) that they may receive
a part in the promise of God “That he that
blesseth thee, shall be blessed, & in the & in
thy seed shall all the nations of the earth
be blessed” I hope to hear by the next letter
from you, that you have been able to appoint
some trust worthy person at marseilles
who will be punctual & not detain any
thing I may send there.

We have had abundant rains &
two great snow storms since I last wrote
& the Well of Job is overflowing & pouring down
the “Valley of fire” “of El Nair” & is regarded as
proof positive of the coming season being
a plentiful one & has caused great rejoicin
g here as it has not been known for many
years.

The English Consul Mr Finn handed
me my “Simen Messiah” all translated into
the Italian Language & I received a letter
from Malta informing me that it had
been translated into the Italian by the
Mashumats there & had caused several of ther
them to return to Judaism, not only in Malta
but also in Tunis.

Bishop Gobat came
out and made a full expose (which was
published in London) of the mission here
under his care as follows, that he could do
no good among the Jews in Christianizing
them for after they had eaten & got a suffi
ciency of wants supplied they returned
again to Judaism this tells all
yours &c
Mr.Warder Cresson
